TaskREST Resource

Endpoints for managing tasks.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{task_id}

Gets an individual task.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
task_id path The task ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json TaskDTO (JSON) The task object.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{task_id}

Saves a task.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
task_id path The task ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json TaskDTO (JSON) The task data.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) A status object indicating success or failure.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/tasks

Saves an array of tasks all at once.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json array of TaskDTO (JSON) The array of tasks.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) A status object indicating success or failure.

DELETE /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{task_id}

Deletes a task. Note that only custom tasks can be deleted.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
org_id path The organization ID. int
task_id path The ID of the task to delete. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json StatusDTO (JSON) A status object indicating success or failure.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{task_id}/sources

Gets the task's source explanation (the regulations that caused the task to be created).

GET /orgs/{org_id}/tasks

Gets an array of open tasks to which the current user is assigned.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.

threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed

409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json UserIncidentTasksDTO (JSON) A list of userIncidentTasksDTO objects.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/due_soon

Gets an array of tasks that are assigned to the current user and due within the next 7 days.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.

Response Body
media type data type description
application/json TaskDTO (JSON) An array of taskDTO objects.

GET /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{id}/members

Gets members of the task. Private tasks will have the returned "members" property set. Non-private tasks will have a null "members" property.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The task ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json MembersDTO (JSON) Returns an object containing the members of the task.

PUT /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{id}/members

Sets the member list.

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The task ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Request Body
media type data type description
application/json MembersDTO (JSON) The new members. Note that the "version" property is ignored for this operation.
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json MembersDTO (JSON) Echos back the set members.

DELETE /orgs/{org_id}/tasks/{id}/members

Deletes the members for this task. This effectively changes the task from a "private" task to a non-private task (to one where any incident member can operate on it).

Request Parameters
name type description constraints
accept header The requested MIME type for the return. This should generally be application/json.  
accept-language header The Accept-Language header as specified in RFC2616. The server will attempt to respect this setting for any formatted date strings that it returns.  
handle_format header The output format for objectHandle objects. See objectHandleFormat for the list of possible values.  
text_content_output_format header The output format for textContentDTO objects. See textContentOutputFormat for the list of possible values.  
threat_hit_prop_format header The output format for threat hit property objects. See threatHitPropertyFormat for the list of possible values.  
x-co3contexttoken header The contents of this token should be taken from the Co3ContextToken header of the JMS or STOMP message.

REST API clients that are not running in the context of an Actions Module invocation can ignore this header.

  
id path The task ID. int
org_id path The organization ID. int
Response Codes
code condition
200 Success
400 Bad request
401 Unauthorized - most commonly, the provided session ID is invalid
403 Forbidden - most commonly, user authentication failed
404 Object not found
409 Conflicting PUT operation
500 Internal error
503 Service unavailable - usually related to LDAP not being accessible
Response Body
media type data type description
application/json MembersDTO (JSON) Echos back the members.
